conclusion: Determine how shadows will change when light source moves downward
Shadows will be cast closer to objects as light source moves downward
Size of shadows will increase as light source moves downward
Shadow A is cast by the object at the top left
Shadow A will move closer to the object and become larger
Shadow B is cast by the object near the center-right
Shadow B will move closer to the object and become larger
Shadow C is cast by the object near the center
Shadow C will move closer to the object and become larger
Shadow D is cast by the object at the bottom left
Shadow D will move closer to the object and become larger
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move closer to their objects and become larger
